FuncDef: The display ntp-service status remote command displays AP clock status information synchronized with a master.
Examples: reference time: 09:37:06.656 UTC Mar 20 2015(D8B668C2.A7F455A7) synchronization state: clock set but frequency not determined
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To monitor an AP's NTP service status or determine fault reasons, run the display ntp-service status remote command to obtain the AP's NTP service status information synchronized with a master. The information includes the clock synchronization status and clock stratum. You can use the information to view the NTP service status and analyze fault reasons.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
